div.l: So meri a fitte ne had sche not full yoore
He priketh harde ⁊and depe as he ware madde
This ioly lif han these two clerkis ladde
Till that the thrid cok be gan to synge
¶ Aleyn wax wery in the dawenynge
For he had swonken all the longe nyght
And seide fare well Malyn swete wight
The day is come I may no lenger bide
But euyr mo wher so I go or ryde
I am thyn owne clerk so haue I sele
Now dere lēmman ꝙquod sche go fare wele
But or thou go oo thyng I woll thee telle
Whan that thou wendist homwarde bithe Mille
Right at the entre of the dore be hynde
Thou schalt a kake of half a buschell fynde
That was maked of thyn owne mele
Whiche that I hilpe my sire for to stele
And gode lemman god the saue ⁊and kepe
And with that worde almoste sche gan to wepe
¶ Aleyn vp rist ⁊and thought or that it dawe
I will go crepen yn be my felawe
And fonde the cradell with his honde a noon
Bi god thought he all wrange I haue mysgon
Myn heed is toty of my swynk to nyght
That maketh me that I go nought a right
I woot wel bi the cradell I haue mysgo
Here lieth the Millere ⁊and his wif also
And forth he goth on twenti deuyll waie
Vn to the bedde ther as the Millere laye
He wende haue cropen bi his felawe Iohn
And bi the Miller yn he crepe a non
And caught hym bi the nekke ⁊and softe he spak
He seide thou Iohn thou swyneshed a wak
For cristes sawle ⁊and here a noble game
For bi that lorde that called is seint Iame
As I haue thries in this schort nyght
Swyued the Millers doughter bolt vp right
While thou hast as a cowarde ben a gast
¶ Ye fals harlot qᵈuod the Miller hast
A fals traytour fals clerk ꝙquod he
Thou schalt be deed bi goddis dignyte
Who durst be so bolde to disparage
Mi doughter that is comen of suche lynage
And bi the throte bolle he caught Aleyn
And he hent hym dispitously a gayn
And on the nose he smote hym with his fist
Down ran the blody streme vp on his brist
